intro: Cyrtochilum ramiro-medinae, commonly known as the Ramiro-Medina's orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to the cloud forests of Colombia. It is a small, terrestrial orchid with a distinctive, narrow leaf and a delicate, spurred flower that typically blooms in the early spring. The plant belongs to the Epidendroideae subfamily and is characterized by its unique floral structure and specific habitat requirements. Cyrtochilum ramiro-medinae is highly specialized, thriving in shaded, humid environments with rich, well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat threats, it is considered a vulnerable species in conservation efforts.
